name: CVE-2022-45061
description: An issue was discovered in Python before 3.11.1. An unnecessary quadratic algorithm exists in one path when processing some inputs to the IDNA (RFC 3490) decoder, such that a crafted, unreasonably long name being presented to the decoder could lead to a CPU denial of service. Hostnames are often supplied by remote servers that could be controlled by a malicious actor; in such a scenario, they could trigger excessive CPU consumption on the client attempting to make use of an attacker-supplied supposed hostname. For example, the attack payload could be placed in the Location header of an HTTP response with status code 302. A fix is planned in 3.11.1, 3.10.9, 3.9.16, 3.8.16, and 3.7.16.
pattern: [(software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:python:python:3.11.0:alpha2:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:python:python:3.11.0:alpha3:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:python:python:3.11.0:alpha4:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:python:python:3.11.0:alpha5:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:python:python:3.11.0:alpha6:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:python:python:3.11.0:alpha1:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:python:python:3.11.0:beta2:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:python:python:3.11.0:beta3:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:python:python:3.11.0:beta4:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:python:python:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:python:python:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:python:python:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:python:python:3.11.0:-:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:python:python:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:python:python:3.11.0:alpha7:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:python:python:3.11.0:beta1:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:python:python:3.11.0:beta5:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:python:python:3.11.0:rc1:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:python:python:3.11.0:rc2:*:*:*:*:*:*')]
